title: Email UNIVESP no Thunderbird
creator: edsonp1976
content:
Boa noite, pessoal! Sou aluno da Universidade Virtual do Estado de S√£o Paulo (UNIVESP) e eles usam o Microsoft 365 como plataforma para o servi√ßo de email deles.

Quando entro no Outlook.com e digito meu endere√ßo de email da univesp (formato 9999999@aluno.univesp.br), sou redirecionado para a p√°gina da Univesp para preencher novamente meu login e senha e ap√≥s esse processo, volto √† pagina do Outlook e uso meu email normalmente.

Entretanto, nunca fui f√£ de servi√ßos de webmail e gostaria de utilizar o Thunderbird para ler meus emails e me comunicar com os professores da universidade.

Tentei fazer a configura√ß√£o do cliente usando os seguintes par√¢metros:

Recebimento: servidor: imap-mail.outlook.com (IMAP); Porta 993, Seguran√ßa SSL/TLS, M√©todo: Senha normal, e preenchi o nome de usu√°rio com meu email univesp;

Envio: Servidor: smtp-mail.outlook.com; Porta 587; Seguran√ßa STARTTLS; M√©todo: Senha normal, e preenchi o nome de usu√°rio com meu email univesp.

O programa apresenta o seguinte erro: "N√£o foi poss√≠vel acessar a conta no servidor. A configura√ß√£o, o nome de usu√°rio ou a senha provavelmente est√£o errados.

Algu√©m conhece uma solu√ß√£o para o que eu gostaria de fazer?

Em tempo, j√° perguntei no suporte da universidade, mas n√£o obtive nenhuma resposta, como de praxe.

Desde j√°, obrigado!

title: In Thunderbird 128, Missing ability to search calendar events beyond the current date.
creator: mr.armh
content:
Lightning had the ability to search the entire calendar for an event, sadly, this new iteration of the calendar built into Thunderbird 128.0.1esr doesn't support anything but today or later events.

Most of the time I use the calendar to search for a previous event (when I was previously somewhere). This is very important and an oversight on the part of who thought the search from now until the end of time was all anyone would need.

Can the functionality be returned to search every event and not just from today onward?

title: Trying to circumvent Windows path limit (260 chars) -> Maildir's emails name semantics
creator: KG-STL
content:
Hi

I'm trying to circumvent the Windows path limit (260 chars), when using Maildir as storage for emails in Thunderbird (for IMAP-configured accounts).

The default path in Windows looks like:

C:\Users\user\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\jesvjtr1.default-release\ImapMail\xxxxxxxx.yyyyyyyyyyyy.com.pl\

which "consumes" 115 chars from 260 available (ok, I can edit profiles.ini, switch "IsRelative" to 0, and move the profile to C:\TB\user\jesvjtr1.default-release" for example, but this is inconvenient as I have to do for each user)

So I'm looking for other way - to make .eml filenames shorter - the current ones looks like: 00b201dac2f4%243f963bb0%24bec2b310%24@pw-xxxxxx.yyy.eml 00cd0e17-2810-4fa0-be24-aa612ae7aae2@victory-zzzzz.aa.eml

But You can ask why? Some of our users has complex folders tree, for example: Inbox -> Obecni KLIENCI -> ABCDEFGHI abcd xyz -> ABCDEFGHI abcd xyz France - Paris -> 2024 -> Oferty -> Zaakceptowane -> Dostarczone

The folders looks like: INBOX.sbd\Obecni KLIENCI.sbd\ABCDEFGHI abcd xyz.sbd\ABCDEFGHI abcd xyz France - Paris.sbd\2024.sbd\Oferty.sbd\Zaakceptowane.sbd\

(it all takes 242 chars)

then there will be "cur" and "tmp" folders inside the last one Zaakceptowane.sbd\cur Zaakceptowane.sbd\tmp

and when You want to store new email in the last folder (using filter), Thunderbird copied new email to tmp folder (using nstmp-xxx name), then move to cur with new name (00b201dac2f4%243f963bb0%24bec2b310%24@pw-xxxxxx.yyy.eml for example) and due to 260 chars limit it doesn't happened.

Emails are stuck in tmp with temporary names and when filter trying to do its thing again, the new nstmp-xxx files are created in tmp and so on - till the free space in disk are exhausted)

So I'm looking for settings that will make the names of .eml files shorter.

I'm curious, why Mozilla doesn't support long path names in Windows (using UNC paths "\\?\" and updating manifest file with these lines) <application xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v3"> 

   <windowsSettings xmlns:ws2="http://schemas.microsoft.com/SMI/2016/WindowsSettings">        <ws2:longPathAware>true</ws2:longPathAware>    </windowsSettings>

</application>
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/128.0;product:thunderbird

title: Server timeout on email send
creator: lncroos
content:
I have an issue with Thunderbird on my PC sending any email of any size larger than a few lines. I can send small test emails with a few lines (<1KB) however any email with attachment or forwarding an email results in a : Sending failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.themessagingco.com.au timed out.

I have tried all combinations of outgoing server settings as recommended by my provider Mail server settings including swapping Security and port but no luck. Please note I can send and receive without issue on my iphones with the same server settings. Currently using port 587, Normal password authentication and STARTTLS.

I found some posts suggesting turning off outgoing email scanning on antivirus - no luck. I have turned off firewalls - no luck. I have tried no authentication (security = none) - no luck.

Thunderbird version is 128.1.0esr (64 bit). Using Norton 360 Antivirus

Strange that I can send small emails but not a size that's of any use Any ideas ???
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/126.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Norton/126.0.0.0;product:thunderbird

title: Missing Emails from Last Year in Inbox Folder
creator: Aela__pls__help
content:
Dear TB Support*ies out there,

I am writing to seek your urgent assistance regarding a critical issue I encountered today with my Thunderbird email client. I have been using Thunderbird since at least 2016, and today, I noticed that all my emails from mid-July 2023 until today's noon have disappeared from my Inbox folder from one moment to the other. Archive and trash are empty.

These emails are crucial for my ongoing work and communications. I am hoping you can guide me on how to recover these missing emails.

Additionally, please advise if there is a possibility to re-import them from my Gmail account, as this is my primary email provider.

Your prompt response and assistance in resolving this matter will be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your support!!!

title: Print Single Event in Calendar
creator: jwells222
content: From what I can tell, there is no way to print the contents of a single calendar event. Calendar events may have important information in the event details, like program agenda or travel directions. Being able to print an event is really rudimentary...a person wouldn't really even think that it cannot be done. So, the work around is to use the Windows program Snip and Sketch to take a picture of the entire event and then print that. Just unbelievable at this stage of Thunderbird's development. Not being able to do print an event is kind of like a word processing program excluding the letter 'x' because it isn't used much. Seriously.
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:129.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/129.0;product:thunderbird

content: Hi, I have a iMac with os Sonoma 14.6 and Thunderbird 128.1.0esr. I try to sign emails with s/mime digital certificates, but i cant. I have a personal digital certificate that i use on my mozilla firefox without any issue to login, sign docs and everything, but on thunderbird i cant sign or encrypted a message. The reason is that when i try to install certificates, it just dont put in on people tab, on Certificate Manager, but on Your Certificates. I try with .p12 format and with .cer format. When i try to import on Your certificates tab, i click import and it just select p12 certificates. If i choose cer dont work. And it import certificates just right. But it doesnt let me choose these certificate to sign emails or encrypt ( account settings - end-to-end-encryption - S/MIME area saying Personal Certificate for Digital Signing with Select.. buton and Personal Certificate for encryption. I just import certificates, it put on your certificates, dont leave me put any on personal. Then i click on Select to assign certificate to sign and says Certificate Manager can¬¥t locate a valid certificate that can be used to digitally sign your messages with an address of . I check that the email address is the same of digital certificate, when i ask autorithy to give me certificate, that certificate, can be used and is associated with the email address i try to sign. But it dont work. Any help?

title: requested update to v.116 instead went to 115.14 esr channel
creator: mark567
content:
I have Thunderbird installed on two Windows machines that I manually keep in sync. I copy my data files and profile back and forth between the two machines as I use each one, and I keep them updated to identical versions. Have been doing this for years with no trouble.

Last time I clicked on "About Thunderbird" on one machine (A) it offered to upgrade from 115.10.1 to 116.0 (auto updates turned off). But the actual update failed and now its offering only to upgrade to 115.14 esr. OK, but now I'm concerned the other machine (B) with the same update prompt (to 116) might not follow the same path, then I have the two versions out of sync and that is a real PITA to fix as I discovered once some years ago.

Why didn't I get the 116 version that was offered in the dialog, and instead switched to esr channel, and how can I be sure the other machine will switch to offering 115.14 esr also so I can keep identical versions? I thought of creating Windows restore point just in case so I can roll back but would rather not risk it.
metadata: ;category:install-and-update;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:129.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/129.0;product:thunderbird;solver_id:6097468

title: Thunderbird Daily 131.0a1 Linux is unable to Select OAuth2 as Auth Method for EWS
creator: iohp2.0
content:
So, I'm currently testing the EWS integration and my email requires OAuth2. Unlike the 128 flatpak (which is all I can use on my main PC since it's immutable) where it would get stuck on Checking Password. My second machine has Ubuntu and I'm running the Daily from today.

It allowed me to create the account but will not pull down any emails, likely due to the lack of Oauth2. I've tried all of the other options for SSL/TLS Auth methods on the security settings for the incoming server. The only options are Normal Password, Encrypted Password, Kerberos/GSSAPI, and NTLM.

Does anyone have any suggestions?
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:129.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/129.0;product:thunderbird

title: Thunderbird lost 6000 emails possibly during Compacting. 4GB mbox limit for 32bit ?
creator: denial
content:
Hello.

We are using Thunderbird ESR v128 32bit. Windows 10 64bit.

Had some 14000 emails since 2012, all working good, incl. recent compacting 2m ago. Today there was another folder compacting running, possibly it didn't end as usual (no message, no error).

Since then we can see for about 6000 most recent emails only header, not the body nor attachments. Tried to repair the folder, it made 6000 headers disappeared completely.

When we checked Inbox and Sent mbox files in profile via text editor, last bottom entry/email there is from 2018 and the files are exactly 4 GB in size.

Is it possible that some 4 GB 32 bit Thunderbird limit was hit and that truncated the large mbox files?

Is there any way to find somewhere on local disk (some temp folder or files) the most recent missing 6000 emails?

Account is using POP and the files are not stored on mail server.

Thank you for any advice.
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/115.0;product:thunderbird
